## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 309, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[777, 302, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 326, 904, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 213, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 81, 94, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 76, 630, 104]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\int_{2}^{11} \frac{8}{4x+1} \, \mathrm{d}x = \ln a\), where \(a\) is an integer to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 112, 917, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 81, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 831, 103]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the stationary points of the curve with equation \(y = \frac{8x}{2x + 3} - 6x + 5\). [5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 112, 917, 970]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[388, 87, 609, 263]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 279, 920, 313]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows parts of the curves with equations \(y = 4\mathrm{e}^{- 2x}\) and \(y = 1 + 0.5\sin 3x\) . Point \(P\) is a point of intersection of the curves, and the shaded region is bounded by the two curves and the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 327, 146, 345]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 327, 826, 345]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) satisfies the equation \(x = -0.5\ln (0.25 + 0.125\sin 3x)\). [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 543, 146, 561]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 543, 920, 591]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part (a), to find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) correct to 4 significant figures. Use an initial value of 0.5 and give the result of each iteration to 6 significant figures. [3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 603, 917, 935]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 917, 88]]<|/det|>
Hence find the area of the shaded region. Give your answer correct to 2 significant figures. [4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 390, 91]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[359, 103, 640, 122]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = ax^{4} + bx^{3} + 13x^{2} - 35x + 15,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 135, 770, 153]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((2x - 1)\) and \((x - 3)\) are factors of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 166, 146, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 166, 366, 184]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 166, 920, 184]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 327, 90]]<|/det|>
Hence factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 918, 497]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 508, 144, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 507, 685, 526]]<|/det|>
Find the least positive value of \(\theta\) in radians such that \(\mathrm{p}(\cot 2\theta) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 507, 920, 526]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 96, 93]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 463, 95]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \((x^{2} - 3)\ln y + 6x = 14.\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 107, 146, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 107, 725, 126]]<|/det|>
Show that there is no point on the curve at which the \(y\)-coordinate is \(\mathrm{e}^{-1}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 138, 917, 592]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 603, 148, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 603, 920, 638]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point \(\left(2, \mathrm{e}^{2}\right)\). Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\), where \(m\) and \(c\) are exact constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 618, 920, 638]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 650, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 96, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Express \(4 \cos \theta \sin (\theta + 30^\circ)\) in the form \(R \cos (2\theta - \alpha) + k\), where \(R > 0\), \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\) and \(k\) is a constant. [6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 123, 920, 965]]<|/det|>
